SENT.plain: A patient with systemic lupus erythematosus had severe hypertension, rapidly worsening renal failure, and multiple successive thrombotic cerebrovascular and retinal lesions develop
In a kidney biopsy specimen luminal thrombi were demonstrated in arteries and arterioles, without vasculitic or inflammatory changes

The patient's plasma was markedly deficient in both prostacyclin stimulating factor (PSF) and vascular plasminogen activator (VPA), and also contained a potent inhibitor of in vitro urokinase-induced fibrinolysis
Treatment with ancrod resulted in striking reversal of the progressive renal damage and clinical recovery from the thrombotic cerebrovascular and retinal lesions
This clinical improvement was associated with improved renal histologic appearance, correction of the PSF and VPA deficiencies, and disappearance of the urokinase inhibitor
Possible mechanisms of action of ancrod are discussed
